SEARCH
Package executor.service.controller

Class ScenarioResultController

java.lang.Object
executor.service.controller.ScenarioResultController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/result") public class ScenarioResultController extends Object
Controller class handling HTTP requests related to scenario results in the application.

This class is annotated with @RestController, indicating that it combines @Controller and @ResponseBody, making it suitable for handling RESTful web service requests. The base request mapping is set to "/result," making this controller responsible for scenario result-related endpoints.

The class works in conjunction with the ScenarioResultService to handle various operations related to scenario results and manages the interaction between the client and the application's business logic.

Endpoints within this controller are designed to support scenario result-related actions, such as retrieving result details, creating new results, updating existing ones, or deleting results based on specific HTTP methods.

Ensure proper dependency injection of the ScenarioResultService to enable seamless communication between the controller and the underlying business logic for scenario results.

Consider further customization of this controller by adding additional methods and request mappings to support additional functionality related to scenario results as needed.

  • Method Details

    • getAllScenarioResults

      @GetMapping("/{username}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<ScenarioResultResponse>> getAllScenarioResults(@PathVariable String username)
      Handles HTTP GET requests to retrieve all scenario results associated with a specific username.

      This method is annotated with @GetMapping, specifying the endpoint "/result/{username}" for handling GET requests related to fetching all scenario results for a particular username. The provided username in the path is used to identify and retrieve scenario results from the underlying ScenarioResultService.

      The method delegates the scenario results retrieval operation to the ScenarioResultService, which interacts with the application's business logic to obtain the relevant scenario results.

      The retrieved scenario results are returned in the response body, wrapped in a ResponseEntity. If no results are found for the given username, an empty list is returned with an HTTP status of HttpStatus.NO_CONTENT to indicate a successful request with no scenario results found.

      This endpoint is designed to provide clients with the ability to view all scenario results associated with a specific user by making a GET request to the "/result/{username}" endpoint.

      Parameters:
      username - The username for which scenario results are to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity<List<ScenarioResultResponse>> containing the scenario results and an HTTP status. If scenario results are found, the status is HttpStatus.OK; otherwise, it is HttpStatus.NO_CONTENT, indicating an empty list.
      See Also:
      • GetMapping
      • ResponseEntity
      • HttpStatus
      • ScenarioResultService
